section.title: The XMLHttpRequest object
section.p: To allow scripts to programmatically connect back to their originating server via HTTP, the following interface MAY be used.

section.p: A more complete description of what can be done with XMLHttpRequest can be found in the IDL below and its associated details.

definition-group.p: This set of constants is used to describe the current state of the object.

constant.name: OPEN_STATE
constant.p: The open() method has been successfully called.

constant.name: SENT_STATE
constant.p: The send() method has been successfully called, but no data has yet been received.

constant.name: RECEIVING_STATE
constant.p: Data is being received, but the data transfer is not yet complete.

constant.name: LOADED_STATE
constant.p: The data transfer has been completed.

attribute.name: onreadystatechange
attribute.p: An attribute that represents a function that MUST be invoked when readyState changes value. The function MAY be called multiple times when readyState is 3 (RECEIVING_STATE).

attribute.name: readyState
attribute.p: The state of the object. Its values are those of the readyState Definition Group.

method.name: open
method.p: Initialises the object by remembering the method, uri, async (defaulting to true if omitted), user (defaulting to null if omitted), and password (defaulting to null if omitted) arguments, setting the readyState attribute to 1 (OPEN_STATE), resetting the responseText, responseXML, status, and statusText attributes to their initial values, and resetting the list of request headers.
If open() is called when readyState is 4 (LOADED_STATE) the entire object MUST be reset.

If the URI given to this method contains a user name and a password (the latter potentially being the empty string), then these MUST be used if the user and password arguments are omitted. If the arguments are not omitted, they take precedence, even if they are null.
method.param: A valid HTTP method name. The GET, POST, and HEAD values MUST be supported.
A URI, which MUST be resolved to an absolute URI using the script's context window.location.href value as base if available, and xml:base otherwise.

method.name: setRequestHeader
method.p: If the readyState attribute has a value other than 1 (Open), an exception MUST be raised. If the header or value arguments contain any U+000A LINE FEED or U+000D CARRIAGE RETURN characters, or if the header argument contains any U+0020 SPACE or U+003A COLON charecters, nothing MUST be done. Otherwise, the request header header MUST be set to value. If the request header header had already been set, then the new value MUST be concatenated to the existing value using a U+002C COMMA followed by a U+0020 SPACE for separation.
The list of request headers MUST be reset when the open() method is called.
User agents MUST not set any headers other than the headers set by the author using this method, with the following exceptions:

ul.li: UAs MUST set the Host header appropriately (see open()) and not allow it to be overridden.
UAs MUST set the Authorization header according to the values passed to the open() method (but MUST allow calls to setRequestHeader() to append values to it).
UAs MAY set the Accept-Charset and Accept-Encoding headers and MUST NOT allow them to be overridden.
UAs MAY set the If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, If-Range, and Range headers if the resource is cached and has not expired (as allowed by HTTP), and MUST NOT allow those headers to be overridden.
UAs MUST set the Connection and Keep-Alive headers as described by the HTTP specification, and MUST NOT allow those headers to be overridden.
UAs SHOULD set the proxy-related headers according to proxy settings of the environment, and MUST NOT allow those headers to be overridden.
UAs MAY give the User-Agent header an initial value, but MUST allow authors to append values to it.
UAs SHOULD set Cookie and Cookie2 headers appropriately for the given URI and given the user's current cookies, and MUST allow authors to append values to these headers.

method.p: In particular, UAs MUST NOT automatically set the Cache-Control or Pragma headers to defeat caching [RFC2616].

method.name: send
method.p: If the readyState attribute has a value other than 1 (OPEN_STATE), an exception MUST be raised. Otherwise, the readyState attribute MUST be set to 2 (SENT_STATE) and a request to uri using method method, authenticating using user and password as appropriate is sent. If the async flag is set to false, then the method MUST not return until the request has completed. Otherwise, it MUST return immediately. (See: open().)

If the method is POST or PUT, then the data passed to the send() method MUST be used for the entity body. If data is a string, the data MUST be encoded as UTF-8 for transmission. If the data is a Document, then the document MUST be serialised using the encoding given by data.xmlEncoding, if specified, or UTF-8 otherwise [DOM3]. If data is not a Document or a DOMString the host language MUST use the stringification mechanisms on the argument that was passed.

If the response is an HTTP redirect (status code 301, 302, 303 or 307), then it SHOULD be transparently followed (unless it violates security or infinite loop precautions). Any other error (including a 401) MUST cause the object to use that error page as the response.

Once the final HTTP status line has been received, the readyState attribute SHOULD be set to to 3 (RECEIVING_STATE). When the request has completed loading, the readyState attribute SHOULD be set to 4 (LOADED_STATE).

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this method is called when readyState has an inappropriate value.

method.name: abort
method.p: Calling this method MUST cancel any network activity for which the object is responsible. In addition, UAs MUST then set readyState to 4 (LOADED_STATE), call the function defined in onreadystatechange and reset the object.

method.name: getAllResponseHeaders
method.p: If the readyState attribute has a value other than 3 (RECEIVING_STATE) or 4 (LOADED_STATE), it MUST be null. Otherwise, it MUST represent all the HTTP headers, as a single string, with each header line separated by a CR (U+000D) LF (U+000A) pair. The status line MUST not be included.

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this method is called when readyState has an inappropriate value.

method.name: getResponseHeader
method.p: If the readyState attribute has a value other than 3 (RECEIVING_STATE) or 4 (LOADED_STATE), it MUST be the empty string. Otherwise, it MUST represent the value of the given HTTP header in the data received so far for the last request sent, as a single string. If more than one header of the given name was received, then the values MUST be concatenated, separated from each other by an U+002C COMMA followed by an U+0020 SPACE. If no headers of that name were received, then it MUST be the empty string. Header names MUST be compared case-insensitively to the method argument (header).

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this method is called when readyState has an inappropriate value.

attribute.name: responseText
attribute.p: If the readyState attribute has a value other than 3 (REPLACEMENT) or 4 LOADED_STATE), it MUST be the empty string. Otherwise, returns the body of the data received so far, interpreted using the character encoding specified in the response, or UTF-8 if no character encoding was specified. Invalid bytes MUST be converted to U+FFFD REPLACEMENT CHARACTER.

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this attribute is accessed when readyState has an inappropriate value.

attribute.name: responseXML
attribute.p: If the readyState attribute has a value other than 4 (LOADED_STATE), it MUST be null. Otherwise, if the Content-Type header is either text/xml, application/xml, or ends in +xml, it MUST be an object that implements the Document interface representing the parsed document. If the document was not an XML document, or if the document could not be parsed (due to an XML well-formedness error or unsupported character encoding, for instance), it MUST be null.

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this attribute is accessed when readyState has an inappropriate value.

attribute.name: status
attribute.p: If the status attribute is not available it MUST raise an exception. It MUST be available when readyState is 3 (REPLACEMENT) or 4 LOADED_STATE). When available, it MUST represent the HTTP status code (typically 200 for a successful connection).

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this attribute is accessed when readyState has an inappropriate value.

attribute.name: statusText
attribute.p: If the statusText attribute is not available it MUST raise an exception. It MUST be available when readyState is 3 (REPLACEMENT) or 4 LOADED_STATE). When available, it MUST represent the HTTP status text sent by the server (appears after the status code).

exception.name: DOMException
exception.code: SHOULD be raised if this attribute is accessed when readyState has an inappropriate value.

section.p: HTTP requests sent from multiple different XMLHttpRequest objects in succession SHOULD be pipelined into shared HTTP connections.
